author: m.kalinin
content:
It's not about an attack vector but about ancient history invariant that makes EL nodes to store entire history in EL network after the Merge. Essentially, EIP-4444 is about pruning ancient history. Also, the history includes receipts aside of payloads.

But I agree that at some point in time when historical block expiration will move to the post-Merge point there will be no need to store blocks in EL network, but only receipts and states.

author: m.kalinin
content: The problem of getting rid of blocks from EL side is to change JSON-RPC API, or user's API in general. Web3 libs may request blocks from beacon chain but that would require changes to the libs, and probably shift in UX, when users will have to switch from one endpoint to another to have requests they were used to
